Irisbond Duo API
  • notitle
Getting and loading calibration data

Introduction

Eye trackers are often shared between several users. In order to avoid adjusting the preferred configuration each time a user is changed, many integrators create a user system in their software.

In this tutorial, you will learn how to extract information about the calibration so the users do not need to calibrate each time they use the eye tracker. Also, if the users performs a calibration and this is bad, there is an option to restore the default calibration data that is optimized for each screen size.

The calibration data, is a string that contains some numbers with the information of the calibration of a user. In your program, you can assign this string to each user, and load them when this user logs in. This can be performed using the following functions:

string CalibStr = IrisbondDuo.getCalibrationString();
//Assign this string to a user profile

Then you only need to load it.

IrisbondDuo.loadCalibrationChar(CalibStr);

Even if the functions exported by the API take char * as parameters, you can input strings as parameters in C# as you can see in the example.

Default calibration

The default calibration is always available for the user. It allows you to use the eye tracker even if you have not calibrated yet. Many people find this calibration to be useful, and works well for them. However, we always encourage users to make their own calibration.

You can get this default calibration string using the following function:

string defCalibStr = IrisbondDuo.getDefaultCalibrationString();

Or you can automatically restore the calibration (overwrite the current one with the default one) like follows:

IrisbondDuo.loadDefaultCalibrationChar();
